name: London
clues: Home to a royal family, it's been through many renovations, some fiery.
A tower where ravens reside, protecting the kingdom's fate.
This serpentine body of water is a royal hideaway in plain sight.
A famous clock, but it's just a nickname for the bell.
Cross it with a sword and find yourself at the theatre.
fun_facts: The London Eye rotates so slowly that it never stops for passengers to get on. It moves at a rate of 0.15 metres per second.
More than 300 languages are spoken in London, making it one of the most linguistically diverse cities in the world.
The Houses of Parliament have a 'tea room' where members can only pay with cash.
London is home to the world's oldest toy shop, Hamleys, which was founded in 1760.
There are secret underground rivers flowing beneath London, like the River Fleet.
